sentences: Willie “Bill” Pinkney (August 15, 1925 – July 4, 2007) was an American performer and singer.
As an original group member, Bill Pinkney was a 1988 inductee into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame with The Drifters .
After Ferbie left, Pinkney switched to the bass part, in which he was heard on "Honey Love," "White Christmas", "Adorable", "Ruby Baby", and many other early Drifters recordings.
In 1954, the Drifters recorded their version of "White Christmas" by Irving Berlin.
In 1954, the Drifters recorded their version of "White Christmas" by Irving Berlin.
That version was featured in the 1990 movie Home
Alone, as well as the 1994 movie "The Santa Clause."
Pinkney can also be heard singing lead on the 1956 recording "I Should Have Done Right" and 1955's "Steamboat".
Pinkney can also be heard singing lead on the 1956 recording "I Should Have Done Right" and 1955's "Steamboat".
Pinkney was in and out of the group from 1956 through 1958.
Pinkney was in and out of the group from 1956 through 1958.
He did not participate in the recording of later hits like "Fools Fall in Love" and "Drip Drop", which featured bass singer Tommy Evans.
In 1958, George Treadwell, the group manager fired all of the individual Drifters and hired all new singers, The Crowns (formally known as the Five Crowns), signing them under the Drifters' name.

sentences: Pinkney died on July 4, 2007 in Daytona Beach, Florida from a heart attack, while staying at the Daytona Beach Hilton.

Pinkney died on July 4, 2007 in Daytona Beach, Florida from a heart attack, while staying at the Daytona Beach Hilton.
Funeral services were held on July 9, 2007 at the Sumter County Exhibition Center in Sumter, South Carolina.

According to the following sources Pinkney was born in Sumter, SC:  Encyclopedia of Rock and Roll, page 286 (also states that his name was spelled both as Pinckney and Pinkney); Rock Movers and Shakers, page 162; Peoples Almanac 2000, page 517.
